summary: This is an email chain from September 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and others regarding the taint review of electronic materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence. The emails discuss the volume of documents (approximately 20,000), the number of seized devices, and coordination with agents and Epstein's defense attorneys.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Correspondent in the email chain, providing information about the document count from the seized materials and discussing the taint review process.

persons.name: Epstein's Attorney
persons.context: Mentioned as having provided search terms for the taint review of seized materials from Epstein's residence.

connections.description: The prosecutor is coordinating with Epstein's defense attorney regarding the taint review process and search terms for seized materials.

events.title: Seized materials made available
events.description: Electronic materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence were made available for review.

events.title: Supervisors request taint review update
events.description: Agents' supervisors requested a status update on the taint review process ahead of a meeting with the ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge).

events.title: Document volume reported
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney reported the taint review yielded about 20,000 documents, with many being non-user files like Adobe instructions.

keyFacts: Approximately 20,000 documents were identified from the taint review of materials seized from Epstein's Manhattan residence, with many being non-user files.
Seizure records indicated approximately 38 computers/electronic storage devices and 55 CDs were taken from Epstein's residence.
Prosecutors expressed skepticism that the volume of seized devices would only result in 20,000 documents, requesting cross-referencing.
Epstein's defense attorney had provided search terms used in the taint review process, indicating coordination between prosecution and defense.
The materials from the seizure were made available for review on September 10, 2019, with status updates being requested by supervisors in mid-September.
